chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gary Lee Willert II

records.addlTxt: Bail/bond hearing on November 21, 2022 at 09:45 am.

9:51 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Gary Lee Willert II not in court.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson appeared by video for Gary Lee Willert II.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Erickson is heard. 
State requests a warrant. 
Court issues a warrant. Defendant to be held for bond hearing.

11:05 AM Case called - appearances stated. 
Defendant Gary Lee Willert II appeared by phone.  Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson in court for Gary Lee Willert II.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty. Erickson is heard on status of this case - still awaiting test results
Atty. Steiner confirms test results have not been received - requests Sept. status date
Jury status hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Jury status hearing on September 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:03 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Gary Lee Willert II appeared by video.  Attorney Lisa Mcdougal appears for Jeffrey Warren Erickson by video for Gary Lee Willert II.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Mcdougal is heard on status.  An offer received. Requests another status date.
Jury status hearing scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Jury status hearing on May 26, 2022 at 11:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Gary Lee Willert III
Current: 1515 Avon Street, La Crosse, WI 54603 United States  (Effective: 01-28-2022)
Prior: 710 2nd Avenue North, Onalaska, WI

Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if positive submit to blood draw.

1:01 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Gary Lee Willert III appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson appeared by video for Gary Lee Willert III, Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Erickson is heard. Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court finds the def freely, voluntarily, knowingly made decision. Court finds probable cause and binds over for further processing's

Atty Erickson is heard on bond. Requests a signature bond. 
Atty Steiner has no objection.

Court orders signature bond.  $500.00 signature bond with the same conditions.  Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if positive submit to blood draw. 

Def is heard, he clarifies that he is Gary Willert II not the III.  

Information has been filed.  Information brought over.  

Atty Erickson waives reading and defendant stands mute.  Clerk will enter a not guilty plea for each of the six counts.
Jury status hearing scheduled for March 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Jury status hearing on March 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.
1/25/22 Inmate request to Judge Rider and Judge Rider's 1/26/22 response to same
1/21/22 Inmate request to Judge Rider and Judge Rider's 1/26/22 response to same

2:07 PM Defendant Gary Lee Willert III appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Jeffrey Warren Erickson appeared in court for Gary Lee Willert III, Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
   Court informs Def. of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each of the six counts.  Def. states understanding of charges and possible penalties.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
    Mr. Willert asks bond be addressed; states his probation hold has been lifted.
    Atty. Steiner states present bond is appropriate; asks no modification be made. 
    Court comments; Def. to talk some more about a plan with Atty. Erickson and will address bond again on Friday.  Court concludes at 2:16 p.m.
Preliminary hearing on January 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
1:23 PM Defendant Gary Lee Willert II appeared by video, in custody, D.A. Luke Steiner, Plaintiff State of Wisconsin appeared by video. 
     Court finds probable cause for numerous offenses.
     D.A. requests $500 cash bond, Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if positive submit to blood draw.   Notes def. on bond with a Monroe Cty. case, on probation for a conviction for possession of meth; also under extended supervision.
     Def. states address of 710 Second Ave. N, Onalaska, 54650.  He requests signature bond.
     Court comments; orders cash bond of $500.00. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if positive submit to blood draw.  Court advises of right to an atty.  
     Court sets for Initial Appearance on Jan. 24, 2022 at 2:00 p.m.
     Court concludes at 1:27 p.m.
Hearing scheduled for January 24, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if positive submit to blood draw.
